items.title: credssp: Server did not response with a CredSSP token after step Step 1. TLS Handshake
items.body:
## Error
```
$ ansible -i inventory/devops -m setup devops-winsvr2012-01 -vvvvvv
ansible 2.9.11
  config file = /home/ansible/.ansible.cfg
  configured module search path = ['/home/ansible/library', '/home/ansible/.ansible/plugins/modules', '/usr/share/ansible/plugins/modules']
  ansible python module location = /usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/ansible
  executable location = /usr/local/bin/ansible
  python version = 3.8.2 (default, Jul 16 2020, 14:00:26) [GCC 9.3.0]
Using /home/ansible/.ansible.cfg as config file
Reading vault password file: /home/ansible/.vault-password
setting up inventory plugins
host_list declined parsing /home/ansible/inventory/devops as it did not pass its verify_file() method
script declined parsing /home/ansible/inventory/devops as it did not pass its verify_file() method
auto declined parsing /home/ansible/inventory/devops as it did not pass its verify_file() method
Parsed /home/ansible/inventory/devops inventory source with ini plugin
Loading callback plugin minimal of type stdout, v2.0 from /usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/ansible/plugins/callback/minimal.py
META: ran handlers
Using module file /usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/ansible/modules/windows/setup.ps1
Pipelining is enabled.
<10.10.190.109> ESTABLISH WINRM CONNECTION FOR USER: administrator on PORT 5986 TO 10.10.190.109
<10.10.190.109> WINRM CONNECT: transport=credssp endpoint=https://10.10.190.109:5986/wsman
<10.10.190.109> WINRM CONNECTION ERROR: Server did not response with a CredSSP token after step Step 1. TLS Handshake - actual 'Negotiate, CredSSP'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/ansible/plugins/connection/winrm.py", line 413, in _winrm_connect
    self.shell_id = protocol.open_shell(codepage=65001)  # UTF-8
  File "/home/ansible/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/winrm/protocol.py", line 166, in open_shell
    res = self.send_message(xmltodict.unparse(req))
  File "/home/ansible/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/winrm/protocol.py", line 243, in send_message
    resp = self.transport.send_message(message)
  File "/home/ansible/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/winrm/transport.py", line 323, in send_message
    response = self._send_message_request(prepared_request, message)
  File "/home/ansible/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/winrm/transport.py", line 328, in _send_message_request
    response = self.session.send(prepared_request, timeout=self.read_timeout_sec)
  File "/home/ansible/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 650, in send
    r = dispatch_hook('response', hooks, r, **kwargs)
  File "/home/ansible/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/requests/hooks.py", line 31, in dispatch_hook
    _hook_data = hook(hook_data, **kwargs)
  File "/home/ansible/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/requests_credssp/credssp.py", line 448, in response_hook
    response = self.handle_401(response, **kwargs)
  File "/home/ansible/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/requests_credssp/credssp.py", line 483, in handle_401
    in_token = self._get_credssp_token(response, credssp_regex,
  File "/home/ansible/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/requests_credssp/credssp.py", line 517, in _get_credssp_token
    raise AuthenticationException(error_msg)
requests_credssp.exceptions.AuthenticationException: Server did not response with a CredSSP token after step Step 1. TLS Handshake - actual 'Negotiate, CredSSP'
devops-winsvr2012-01 | UNREACHABLE! => {
    "changed": false,
    "msg": "credssp: Server did not response with a CredSSP token after step Step 1. TLS Handshake - actual 'Negotiate, CredSSP'",
    "unreachable": true
}
```

## Ansible Inventory Settings
```
[windows:vars]
ansible_user=<redacted>
ansible_password=<redacted>
ansible_connection=winrm
ansible_winrm_transport=credssp
ansible_winrm_server_cert_validation=ignore

[windows]
devops-winsvr2012-01   ansible_host=10.10.190.109
```

## Ansible Environment

$ cat /etc/lsb-release 
```
DISTRIB_ID=Ubuntu
DISTRIB_RELEASE=20.04
DISTRIB_CODENAME=focal
DISTRIB_DESCRIPTION="Ubuntu 20.04.1 LTS"
```

$ ansible --version
```
ansible 2.9.11
  config file = /home/ansible/.ansible.cfg
  configured module search path = ['/home/ansible/library', '/home/ansible/.ansible/plugins/modules', '/usr/share/ansible/plugins/modules']
  ansible python module location = /usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/ansible
  executable location = /usr/local/bin/ansible
  python version = 3.8.2 (default, Jul 16 2020, 14:00:26) [GCC 9.3.0]
```

$ pip3 list | egrep  "winrm|credssp"
```
pywinrm                0.4.1               
requests-credssp       1.1.1               
winrmlib               1.3  
```

## Remote (from Ansible) CURL to Windows Server 2012R2
```

$ curl -kvvv https://10.10.190.109:5986/wsman
--
*   Trying 10.10.190.109:5986...
* TCP_NODELAY set
* Connected to 10.10.190.109 (10.10.190.109) port 5986 (#0)
* ALPN, offering h2
* ALPN, offering http/1.1
* successfully set certificate verify locations:
*   CAfile: /etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt
CApath: /etc/ssl/certs
* TLSv1.3 (OUT), TLS handshake, Client hello (1):
* TLSv1.3 (IN), TLS handshake, Server hello (2):
* TLSv1.2 (IN), TLS handshake, Certificate (11):
* TLSv1.2 (IN), TLS handshake, Server key exchange (12):
* TLSv1.2 (IN), TLS handshake, Server finished (14):
* TLSv1.2 (OUT), TLS handshake, Client key exchange (16):
* TLSv1.2 (OUT), TLS change cipher, Change cipher spec (1):
* TLSv1.2 (OUT), TLS handshake, Finished (20):
* TLSv1.2 (IN), TLS handshake, Finished (20):
* SSL connection using TLSv1.2 / ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA384
* ALPN, server did not agree to a protocol
* Server certificate:
*  subject: CN=WIN-U5410N2J187
*  start date: Aug  3 17:07:52 2020 GMT
*  expire date: Aug  1 17:07:52 2030 GMT
*  issuer: CN=Atlantic.Net Management - Do not remove
*  SSL certificate verify result: unable to get local issuer certificate (20), continuing anyway.
> GET /wsman HTTP/1.1
> Host: 10.10.190.109:5986
> User-Agent: curl/7.68.0
> Accept: */*
>
* Mark bundle as not supporting multiuse
< HTTP/1.1 405
< Allow: POST
< Server: Microsoft-HTTPAPI/2.0
< Date: Wed, 05 Aug 2020 11:33:17 GMT
< Connection: close
< Content-Length: 0
<
* Closing connection 0
* TLSv1.2 (OUT), TLS alert, close notify (256):
```

## Windows Environment
Operating System: Windows Server 2012R2
SSL Certificate: Self Signed

WinRM / CredSSP setup was done via the Ansible provided PowerShell script, same on all Windows Servers tested against.
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/devel/examples/scripts/ConfigureRemotingForAnsible.ps1


```

PS C:\Users\Administrator> Test-WSMan
--
 
 
wsmid           : http://schemas.dmtf.org/wbem/wsman/identity/1/wsmanidentity.xsd
ProtocolVersion : http://schemas.dmtf.org/wbem/wsman/1/wsman.xsd
ProductVendor   : Microsoft Corporation
ProductVersion  : OS: 0.0.0 SP: 0.0 Stack: 3.0
 
 
 
PS C:\Users\Administrator> winrm e winrm/config/listener
Listener
Address = *
Transport = HTTP
Port = 5985
Hostname
Enabled = true

CertificateThumbprint
ListeningOn = 10.10.190.109, 127.0.0.1, ::1, fe80::5efe:10.10.190.109%14, fe80::14e4:a20e:167f:f4e0%12
 
Listener

PS C:\Users\Administrator> winrm get winrm/config
Config
```

## Windows Event Log Errors
```
Log Name:      System
Source:        Schannel
Date:          8/5/2020 5:16:37 AM

    <Provider Name="Schannel" Guid="{1F678132-5938-4686-9FDC-C8FF68F15C85}" />

```

----
CredSSP is working against my Windows Server 2016 and Windows Server 2019 test servers.  However, when I started testing against Windows Server 2012R2, I get these failures.

Can anyone provide some thoughts or point me in a direction to further troubleshoot ?

items.title: error: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'LICENSE' when attempting to build a wheel
items.body:
I'm getting the No file found (LICENSE) when attempting to build a wheel.

The specific command is as follows
Error building wheel for requests-credssp 1.0.2: Command '['/pyenv/versions/3.6.2/bin/pip', 'wheel', '--no-cache-dir', '--no-deps', '--no-binary', ':all:', '--index-url', '**local pypi mirror**', '-w', '/tmp/tmp1rphi_pp', 'requests-credssp==1.0.2', '--build-option', '--universal']' returned non-zero exit status 1.

items.title: error message with Rundeck authenticating to Windows with pywinrm Credssp
items.body:
While running a job with pywinrm plugin in Rundeck to a Windows 2012 R2 server host with Credssp authentication, we are receiving this error message only on a particular environment.

"authenticationexception server did not response with a credssp token after step 1 tls handshake actual"

Winrm protocol is running on the remote Windows host with this settings on the service:

```
AllowUnencrypted = false
        Auth
            Basic = true
            Kerberos = true
            Negotiate = true
            Certificate = false
            CredSSP = true
            CbtHardeningLevel = Relaxed
        DefaultPorts
            HTTP = 5985
            HTTPS = 5986
        IPv4Filter = *
        IPv6Filter = *
        EnableCompatibilityHttpListener = false
        EnableCompatibilityHttpsListener = false
        CertificateThumbprint
        AllowRemoteAccess = true
    Winrs
        AllowRemoteShellAccess = true
        IdleTimeout = 7200000
        MaxConcurrentUsers = 2147483647
        MaxShellRunTime = 2147483647
        MaxProcessesPerShell = 2147483647
        MaxMemoryPerShellMB = 1024
        MaxShellsPerUser = 50
```

It is weird that we were able to run the job with NTLM authentication.

This setting was also enabled on the Windows server node.
Enable-WSManCredSSP -Role "Server"

Is there any clue to check further? Appreciate your comments on this.

items.title: Timeline for Kerberos support
items.body:
Hi jborean93,

Is Kerberos support something that will be implemented rather soon or is this more a project for "someday"?

Thanks, Marcus
